tagged_story_for_tts:
<[silence:3400]>
"Gravity’s rhythm. Traps in space’s dance."
<[silence:2400]>
"Orbital resonance traps" happen when gravity’s push-and-pull locks objects into repeating patterns—like a jump rope’s swing matching your jump.<[silence:2400]

Most think of orbits as smooth circles.<[silence:1200]>
But resonance traps are gravity’s speed bumps—where a planet’s tug nudges asteroids or moons into precise ratios.<[silence:1200]>
Example: Jupiter’s gravity snares asteroids into 3:2 or 1:1 orbits, clustering them like cars stuck behind a slow truck.<[silence:2400]

Pluto and Neptune avoid collisions because their orbits sync: Pluto loops twice for every three Neptune laps.<[silence:1200]>
Saturn’s rings have gaps where tiny moons sweep debris into resonance traps, clearing paths like a broom.<[silence:2400]

These traps aren’t rare—they’re cosmic traffic rules, shaping rings, asteroid belts, and even exoplanets.<[silence:1200]>
Without them, solar systems would be chaotic.<[silence:1200]

Three related subjects are Lagrange points dynamics, Kirkwood gaps mechanics, and tidal force sculpting.<[silence:2400]>

"Gravity’s rhythm. Traps in space’s dance. "

"Orbital resonance traps" happen when gravity’s push-and-pull locks objects into repeating patterns—like a jump rope’s swing matching your jump. <[silence:2400]

Most think of orbits as smooth circles.
But resonance traps are gravity’s speed bumps—where a planet’s tug nudges asteroids or moons into precise ratios.
Example: Jupiter’s gravity snares asteroids into 3:2 or 1:1 orbits, clustering them like cars stuck behind a slow truck. <[silence:2400]

Pluto and Neptune avoid collisions because their orbits sync: Pluto loops twice for every three Neptune laps.
Saturn’s rings have gaps where tiny moons sweep debris into resonance traps, clearing paths like a broom. <[silence:2400]

These traps aren’t rare—they’re cosmic traffic rules, shaping rings, asteroid belts, and even exoplanets.
Without them, solar systems would be chaotic. <[silence:1200]

Three related subjects are Lagrange points dynamics, Kirkwood gaps mechanics, and tidal force sculpting.
